intro: Lotononis nutans, commonly known as the nodding lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its delicate, drooping inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, round fruits. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
